column4: well i was only using 7.10 because i needed the older version of gcc to compile a driver...can i get an older version of gcc with jaunty and use it?
or if someone could help me, i am trying to compile this driver http://zd1211.wiki.sourceforge.net/VendorBasedDriver
or you could use the alternatives system... sudo update-alternatives --config cc
it's an answer to your last question
it will let you select the gcc version called by gcc when you have multiple versions installed
yeah I was wrong, that would let you select among different compilers, but not among different gcc versions
I guess try setting the CC environment variable as jrib suggested before
but where do i use that?
you could set it in your shell before you run the configure script
another option would be changing the /usr/bin/gcc link to point to gcc-4.1 instead of gcc-4.3
do 'ls -l /usr/bin/gcc' and you'll see what I mean
how to i point it to the older version?
i am lost, how to i tell it to make with a speficif version of gcc?
